result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marquis A Mckenzie

records.addlTxt: Defendant Marquis A Mckenzie appeared by video.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn appeared by video for Marquis A Mckenzie.  Prosecuting attorney M Samir Siddique in court for the State of Wisconsin. Final pretrial conference held.  Parties remain in trial posture. Jury trial remains scheduled on 11/09/2022 in Branch 30.

Defendant Marquis A Mckenzie appeared by video.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn appeared by video for Marquis A Mckenzie.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a status conference. Defense is in receipt of discovery and offer and requests final pre-trial and jury trial dates. Jury trial documents to be filed by 10/21/22.
Case adjourned.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Marquis A Mckenzie in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Sarah Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Marquis A Mckenzie appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in court for a pre-trial conference. Defense is in receipt of discovery and offer and needs time to review.
Case adjourned.  Status conference scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with GS.
Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Marquis A Mckenzie in court.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible.  
The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 30.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7/18/22 @ 1:30p
